fields.description:
School of Social Innovation

Are you looking to make a difference in your community and the world? Are you interested in developing the skills and network necessary to do so?

The P2PU School of Social Innovation is a global, open source community for organizing peer study groups on topics like conflict resolution, project management for social innovators, and social innovation in education. SoSI is united by the common purpose of helping all people strengthen skills that are important for social innovators.

SoSI achieves this through free, peer-designed-and-directed study groups, which use a combination of online and offline project-based learning. The online platform allows study groups of a virtually unlimited size to access and remix high-quality open source curriculum, lectures and other resources for deepening theoretical understanding in international, collaborative teams, while participant-led offline citizen circles provide the opportunity for participants to work in their local context and to develop skills like empathy, resilience, and cooperation- skills which are often learned best through deeper practice, in person.

About Us

  • About SoSI
  • About Citizen Circles
  • What is a Citizen Circle?
  • Contact Us
fields.name: School of Social Innovation

fields.description:
School of the Mathematical Future

School of the Mathematical Future is organized by Natural Math family learning network, Math 2.0 interest group, and P2PU (Peer to Peer University). We are building an open learning environment for mathematics educators working in diverse communities and networks. Our classes are open and free.

Contact Us

  • Discussion group for School of Math Future
  • Announcement list for the School of Math Future
fields.name: School of the Mathematical Future

fields.description:
School of Webcraft is a free, online community for learning open web development.

We believe that learning with others is the best way to help people learn the skills and theory that they need to create web sites and apps using modern open web technologies.


Get started today by signing up for Webmaking 101. (coming soon)

Webmaking 101 is a free course that will provide you the tools you need to become a knowledgeable web developer.

Browse courses or Get notified of Webmaking 101 launch
fields.name: School of Webcraft

fields.description:
School of the Mathematical Future

Pilot: This pilot for a P2PU School of Ed brings the model of open, community-based peer learning to professional development for K-12 teachers.

Hands-on: School of Ed is about hands-on learning driven by each educator's particular needs and classroom situations. It's about connecting, collaborating, and creating, not just reading or studying.

Seven Courses: The pilot includes seven free, online, open-licensed courses that will be run between September and November, 2011. The content focus of these courses is on using innovative methods to encourage deeper learning for students. This will be modeled through innovative professional development courses focused on peer learning and hands-on, learner-driven tasks.

Registration is now open for these courses.

Anyone can “follow” a course. Applying to be a participant is the next level of commitment. In order to maintain a high level of engagement, the number of participants will be limited.

If you are planning to apply to be a participant:

  • Make sure your P2PU profile is complete.
  • Read the course's full description and syllabus, and make sure you can commit to the work involved.
  • Read and answer the sign-up questions.
     

Sign-up close dates are listed below. Applicants will be notified of their status one week after the close dates.

Courses start in September, 2011. (See individual courses for dates.)

Course titles include:

  • Differentiating Instruction - description, sign-up open until Sept. 19 (click PARTICIPATE to apply)
  • Student Engagement - description, sign-up open until Sept. 12 (click PARTICIPATE to apply)
  • OER in the K-12 Classroom - description, sign-up open until Sept. 19 (click PARTICIPATE to apply)
  • Teaching in Online and Blended Classrooms - description, sign-up open until Sept. 12 (click PARTICIPATE to apply)
  • Multimedia and Graphics to Facilitate Deeper Learning - description, sign-up open until Oct. 3 (click PARTICIPATE to apply)
  • Writing & Common Core: Deeper Learning for All - description, sign-up open until Sept. 26 (click PARTICIPATE to apply)
  • Using Web 2.0 and Social Media to Encourage Deeper Learning - description, sign-up open until Sept 19 (click PARTICIPATE to apply)

    [embed:http://vimeo.com/27619552]
     

All courses in this school are free, open-licensed (CC BY), and online, with most courses running six weeks.
fields.name: School of Ed (pilot)

fields.description: Badge awarded upon marking all Webmaking101's Introduce Yourself challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: Introduce Yourself

fields.description: Badge awarded upon marking all Webmaking101's Writing HTML by Hand challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: Writing HTML by Hand

fields.description: Badge awarded upon marking all Webmaking101's Choose Your Weapon challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: Text Editor

fields.description: Badge awarded upon marking all Webmaking101's HTML Hunting in the World Around You challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: HTML is All Around You

fields.description: Badge awarded upon marking all Webmaking101's Your Domain challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: Domain Name

fields.description: Badge awarded upon marking all Webmaking101's Your Hosting challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: Your Webspace

fields.description: Badge awarded upon marking all Webmaking101's You're Live challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: You're LIVE

fields.description: This Badge is automatically awarded to you upon marking all Webmaking101 challenge tasks as completed.
fields.name: Webmaking101 Basic

fields.description: This Badge is automatically awarded to you for helping us test the Beta Webmaking101 challenges!
fields.requirements: You need to mark all tasks as completed in at least one Webmaking101's challenge.
fields.name: Beta Hero

fields.description: Badge awarded by peers as a way to say hello (wave) to each other.
fields.requirements: You need at least 1 peer to award you this badge.
fields.name: Wave

fields.description: The Super Blogger Badge recognizes the ability to consistently write informative, engaging and well presented blog posts while explain clearly and concisely concepts to various audiences.
fields.requirements: You need at least 1 peer to say that you consistently write informative, engaging and well presented blog posts while explain clearly and concisely concepts to various audiences.
fields.name: Super Blogger

fields.description: The Helpful Feedback Badge recognizes the ability to provide helpful and interesting feedback while maintaining a respectful tone.
fields.requirements: You need at least 1 peer to say that you provide helpful and interesting feedback while maintaining a respectful tone.
fields.name: Helpful Feedback

fields.description: The Team Player badge recognizes members who help push work forward within the community and motivate other team members to do so.
fields.requirements: You need at least 1 peer to say that you help push work forward within the community and motivate other team members to do so.
fields.name: Team Player

fields.description: Learners create multiple representations such as text, diagrams, media, sketches, physical forms to record and express ideas in creative ways.
fields.requirements: You need at least 1 peer to say that you create multiple representations such as text, diagrams, media, sketches, physical forms to record and express ideas in creative ways.
fields.name: Creative Presentation

fields.description: The HTML Basic Badge recognizes the ability to write an html page by making basic use of HTML tags.
fields.requirements: More than 3 peers -- by an average rating of 3 -- have said that you can use the Mozilla Developer Network HTML reference [0] to identify and use basic HTML tags , translate HTML tags like <div> , <p> into real world structures.
fields.name: HTML Basic

fields.description: The DNS Badge recognizes the ability to describe what DNS is and how it works.
fields.requirements: More than 3 peers -- by an average rating of 3 -- have said that you can communicate what DNS is by using different types of media, have a domain name that can be used to further explore DNS.
fields.name: DNS Basic

fields.description: The Hosting Badge recognizes the ability to implement web hosting services to set up your own domain.
fields.requirements: More than 3 peers -- by an average rating of 3 -- have said that you can configure a DNS to point at a personal hosting account, provide valuable information on web hosting services.
fields.name: Hosting

fields.description: The Publishing Badge recognizes the ability to take content from a local computer, publish it live on the web and be able to view it in a browser.
fields.requirements: More than 3 peers -- by an average rating of 3 -- have said that you can install an FTP or SFTP client, upload content that is visible live in a browser.
fields.name: Publishing

fields.description: The Organizer badge recognizes anyone at P2PU who has organized a course or a study group with at least one person completing it.
fields.requirements: You have organized a course or a study group with at least one person completing it. This is a manually awarded badge.
fields.name: Organizer

fields.description: The challenge creator recognizes anyone who has authored a challenge.
fields.requirements: You have authored a challenge. This is a manually awarded badge.
fields.name: Challenge Creator

fields.description: The Mentor badge recognizes peers who have signed up to help others learn on a one-on-one basis.
fields.requirements: You have signed up to help others learn on a one-on-one basis. This is a manually awarded badge.
fields.name: Mentor

fields.description: The Adopter Badge recognizes community members who have adopted a challenge.
fields.requirements: You have offered your help in a challenge after completing all its tasks. This is a manually awarded badge.
fields.name: Adopter

translate HTML tags like

into real world structures
communicate what DNS is by using  different types of media
have a domain name that can be used to further explore DNS

fields.title: Full Description
fields.content:
Please fill out the 's full description. In this page you could:

  • Describe the purpose of the and the learning goals for the tasks within.
  • Describe your role in this . What made you interested in this topic? What do you hope to achieve by organizing this ? Are you an expert, enthusiastic or a novice?
  • Include any prerequisite knowledge or skills needed to participate in the , the intended start date, estimated pace, commitment, amount of work, and the length of time the participants can expect to work together (a few days, a few weeks, or forever).
  • Provided any other information that could be useful for people interested in joining the . In what ways can participants expect to contribute to the creation of tasks and assessing each others\' contributions? What will the final task comprise?
